channel.title: Help in item
channel.description: How i can make item cant trade / and cant sell please heelp

item.title: Help in item
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

oh, i missread then, didn’t notice it was an enchanced loop

Read full topic

item.title: Help in item
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:7, topic:533596”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=652387.msg4371707#msg4371707 date=1380838086]

final int[] UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS = { 1,2,3 };

for (int i : UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS) {
if (tradedItem == i) {
message("You can't trade this item.");
return;
}
}

Find where your trading is handled, and add something along these lines when they wish to trade an item. Obviously variables will be different.

Same applies to your shops. Find where the selling is handled and add something like this.
[/quote]shouldnt it be
if(tradeItem == UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS[i]
?[/quote]
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/for.html

i refers to all the values in the array in the enhanced for loop. You’d be right if it was

for (int i = 0; i < UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS.length; i++)

UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS[i]

Read full topic

item.title: Help in item
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:6, topic:533596”][code=java]
final int[] UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS = { 1,2,3 };

for (int i : UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS) {
if (tradedItem == i) {
message(“You can’t trade this item.”);
return;
}
}
[/code]

Find where your trading is handled, and add something along these lines when they wish to trade an item. Obviously variables will be different.

Same applies to your shops. Find where the selling is handled and add something like this.[/quote]shouldnt it be
if(tradeItem == UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS[i]
?

Read full topic

item.title: Help in item
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

final int[] UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS = { 1,2,3 };

for (int i : UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS) {
if (tradedItem == i) {
message("You can't trade this item.");
return;
}
}

Find where your trading is handled, and add something along these lines when they wish to trade an item. Obviously variables will be different.

Same applies to your shops. Find where the selling is handled and add something like this.

Read full topic

item.title: Help in item
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Make a constant array that contains the items you want to not make tradeable/sellable:

public static final int[] UNTRADEABLE_ITEMS = {6570};

then make it so that in your Shop classes and your Trade manager, it checks to see if the item is traceable/sellable by accessing this array.

Read full topic
